chapter.title: List of Tags and Empty Categories

row.entry: non-textual material (e.g., milestones and parser’s comments)
verb, active secondary sequence (imperfect, aorist, pluperfect)
verb, middle/passive secondary sequence (imperfect, aorist, pluperfect)
verb, active primary sequence (present, future, perfect)
verb, middle/passive primary sequence (present, future, perfect)
εἰ in the meaning ‘whether’ introducing an indirect question
may be used temporarily to tag a lemma that is difficult to categorize
marks optatives replacing indicatives in secondary sequence
marks optatives replacing subjunctives in secondary sequence

sect1.title: Syntactic Tags
sect1.para: The contents of the following table(s) are not exhausative but rather give the most common combinations of basic, “dash,” and extended tags.

row.entry: adjectival constituent, ambiguous projection (ADJ, ADJ', or ADJP)
adverbial constituent, ambiguous projection (ADV, ADV', or ADVP)
infinitival subject (or associate in null-expletive construction)
noun phrase, agent in a passive
noun phrase, object in a case determined by prepositional verbal prefix
noun phrase, object in a quirky case
nominal constituent, ambiguous projection (N, N', or NP)
quantificational constituent, ambiguous projection (Q, Q', or QP)
optative replacing indicative in secondary sequence
optative replacing subjunctive in secondary sequence
object in case determined by prepositional verbal prefix
indicative ὅτι-type complement clause or infinitive of indirect discourse
trace of A-movement; also default empty category
null element (e.g., null complementizer, empty operator)
abbreviation mnemonic for “interpret constituent here”; trace of extraposition, scrambling, or other movement that does not fit neatly into the A/A' dichotomy
